column2: @bmann @ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer @BlockchainComns @WalletConnect sounds like an eip opp! üôå

@bmann @ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer @BlockchainComns I think it‚Äôs just a matter of time before native mobile wallets support their own version of snaps. @WalletConnect could evolve to support RPC extensions with little hassle.

@ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer @BlockchainComns As you‚Äôve already touched on in your research, we‚Äôre really optimistic about efforts like @gnosisSafe and @argentHQ who have production deployments with meaningful multisigs. And of course best practices need to make their way to those multisig shardbearers too.

@ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer @BlockchainComns If I could press a button and have wallet infrastructure and the EVM use HD keys and ZKPs to demonstrate relationships to achieve new-key-per-tx, believe me I would. But ultimately the market plays an important role here and it‚Äôs dangerous to ignore it.

@ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer @BlockchainComns Otherwise you would need to make a compelling GTM strategy for users to abandon their current wallets for one that supports your proposed system perfectly as imagined, or convince existing wallets to adopt your scheme entirely.

@ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer @BlockchainComns As mentioned in my previous response, I believe MM snaps and related systems that allow for further derived HD keys are the best shot at implementing the system you describe at scale.

@ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer Furthermore, the specification supports EIP-1271 which does enable multiple key usage, multi-sig, and rotation. Was this considered in your analysis?

@ChristopherA @chrismessina @kimdhamilton @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer We can only do so much with a single spec, and we won‚Äôt be able to solve multiple key use and rotation in one fell swoop, as convenient as that would be. There is a reason for multiple BIPS and I‚Äôm sure you know best of all that these things take time and combined effort.
RT @matthew_d_green: Ugh god. Serious flaws in the way Samsung phones encrypt key material in TrustZone and it‚Äôs embarrassingly bad. They u‚Ä¶
@ChristopherA @kimdhamilton @chrismessina @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer @DeanTribble @marksammiller https://t.co/id1JLXRYSi

@ChristopherA @kimdhamilton @chrismessina @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris @selfissued @justin__richer m3tam@sk snaps allow for additional ad hoc key derivations within an extension, written in a secure subset of javascript invented by @DeanTribble and @marksammiller. extensions of a browser extension is kinda ü§î but i don‚Äôt see a better path forward frankly

@chrismessina @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid @bluesky @willnorris i‚Äôm really grateful that we might have another swing at this with web3, and i think we can agree it‚Äôs too important to mess up. really hoping to have your support in this along with other old-timers like @selfissued @justin__richer @ChristopherA @kimdhamilton and so many more

@chrismessina @Obstropolos @SpruceID @openid yes it‚Äôs really apparent that folks who were building oauth and oidc really wanted a more decentralized web and to put users first, artifacts like https://t.co/YrX25UvocD are a clear testament to this. it sucks to see how it ultimately evolved.

@chrismessina @Obstropolos then you may be happy to learn that @SpruceID ‚ù§Ô∏è @openid!! we are planning SIOPv2 compat for SIWE, welcome you to join our community calls to discuss further, thanks for your clarifications. we‚Äôre just trying to follow through on the impls too

@chrismessina @Obstropolos Our OIDC impl is here!
https://t.co/7X2VjvzQD9

@chrismessina @Obstropolos With respect to deployed systems, we love https://t.co/A0kmwxSxb5 (https://t.co/xMVXzODLnS). Could you please share where to find the source code for Google, Facebook, https://t.co/9i44Ymquev, and Active Directory impls to follow through on your claims?
